title: Hair Fall SOS Roadmap
subtitle: Stop daily shedding, thicken density, and know exactly when to escalate to regenerative medicine.
summary: This guide explains the most common triggers we diagnose in clinic, the lab markers worth checking, evidence-backed at-home upgrades, and how PRP, exosomes, or Regenera® micro-grafts fit into your plan.

sections.title: Spot the dominant trigger
sections.intro: Multiple factors can snowball into thinning. Work through the fast checks below before you panic-buy supplements.

items.heading: Nutrient gaps & ferritin dips
items.body: Order ferritin, serum iron, B12, vitamin D, thyroid panel, and inflammatory markers (CRP). Ferritin below 70 ng/mL, even when 'within range', often correlates with diffuse shedding. We pair micronutrient therapy with PRP only after these labs are corrected.

items.heading: Hormone or medication shifts
items.body: Note any new contraception, PCOS flare, post-partum hormonal crash, or finasteride/intake changes within the last 3–6 months. Stress hormones like cortisol spike telogen effluvium too.

items.heading: Mechanical + inflammatory triggers
items.body: Look for seborrhoeic dermatitis, psoriasis plaques, tight hairstyles, or constant heat styling. Calm inflammation first with prescription topicals before high-yield PRP.

sections.title: At-home upgrades that actually matter
sections.intro: Use a layered approach for 12 weeks before assessing progress.

items.heading: Daily scalp nutrition
items.body: Microneedling once weekly (1.5 mm max), peptide-rich serums, and caffeine/polynucleotide tonics boost blood flow. Pair with protein-forward meals and omega-3 intake.

items.heading: Inflammation control
items.body: Use medicated shampoo twice weekly for micro-inflammation, plus LED red light (630–660 nm) 10 minutes daily to extend the growth phase.

items.heading: Lifestyle stabilisers
items.body: Aim for 7.5+ hours sleep, resistance training 2x weekly, and guided breathing. Stress hormones directly shorten anagen cycles.

sections.title: When to book regenerative treatments
sections.intro: Clinic therapies compress timelines when lifestyle changes are not enough.

items.heading: Dual-spin PRP
items.body: Ideal for early thinning or post-partum shedding. We deliver three sessions, four weeks apart, using meso-gun coverage and LED boosts. Expect visible density at week 12.

items.heading: Exosome or polynucleotide boosters
items.body: Bioactive exosomes accelerate regrowth in stubborn zones; polynucleotides calm inflamed scalps and enhance shine.

items.heading: Regenera® micro-grafts
items.body: For receding temples or long-standing patches, micro-grafts supply progenitor cells and matrix proteins. Combine with maintenance PRP every six months.

faqs.question: How long should I try lifestyle tweaks before PRP?
faqs.answer: Give any at-home plan 12 weeks while you normalise labs. If shedding persists, schedule a trichology-led consultation so we can combine diagnostics with PRP or exosomes.

faqs.question: Can I stay on minoxidil or finasteride?
faqs.answer: Yes. We often keep patients on their prescription or topical plan, but we adjust dosages after lab review to minimise side effects.

faqs.question: What does maintenance look like?
faqs.answer: Most patients book a single PRP booster every 6–9 months plus LED sessions during seasonal shedding.
